name: Beef Shepherd's Pie with Rosemary Garlic Cauliflower Crust
steps: In a small saucepan, combine sliced garlic, whole sprigs of rosemary and olive oil over low heat - steep with preparing other components for about 15-20 minutes. Strain and resereve oil when ready.

Combine cauliflower florets and quaratered potato in a pot and cover with cold water. Season with a pinch of salt, bring to a boil annd let simmer until tender and can be easily mashed with a spoon - about 15-20 minutes.
While cauliflower and potatoes are cooking, preheat a larage cast iron skillet on medium-high heat, add 1 tbsp of olive oil and ground beef - cook until beef is heavily browned - about 10-12 minutes.
Remove beef from pan, add 1 tbsp of olive oil and the remaining vegetables, except corn - season with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Saute vegetables until lightly browned yet still firm.

While vegetables are cooking, strain the cauliflower/potato mix and add to a stand mixer or large bowl. Whip until mixture is fluffy and smooth. Drizzle in the infused olive oil and season to taste with salt and black pepper - reserve while filling is prepared.
Once vegetables are browned, add minced rosemary - stir to combine.
Add tomato paste anad cook for 1 minute. Add all-purpose flour and cook for an additional minute.
Add beef stock, stir and allow mixture to come to a simmer and thicken slightly. You want the mixture to have absorbed the majority of the liquid while still a bit loose
Remove from heat, add corn, minced parsley and mix - season to taste.
Add dollops of the cauliflower mash on top of the filling and spread in an even layer - ensure crust goes to the edges of the pan to prevent filling from bubbling over.
Bake shepherd's pie in the oven for 25 minutes - finish with the broiler for the last 10 minutes until the top is golden brown.
Allow finished shepherd's pie to cool for 5 minutes. Serve with minced parsley and enjoy!
